content.body:
### Response Fields | Index | Field | Type | Description | | :---- | :-------------- | :--------------------------------- | :-------------------------------------------------------- | | \[0] | POSITION\_ARRAY | [Position Array](#positions-array) | Each index contains one of the n current user's positions | #### Positions Array {`
Index Field Type Description
[0] SYMBOL string Pair (tBTCUSD ...)
[1] STATUS string Position status (ACTIVE)
[2] AMOUNT float Position value. Positive for long and negative for short positions
[3] BASE_PRICE float Base price of the position (average traded price of all previous orders related to the position).
[4] FUNDING float Amount of funding associated with the position
[5] FUNDING_TYPE int 0 for daily, 1 for term
[6] PL float Profit & Loss (includes 0.2% fee to close position)
[7] PL_PERC float Profit & loss percentage
[8] PRICE_LIQ float Liquidation price
[9] LEVERAGE float Leverage used for the position
[ . . . ]
[11] POSITION_ID int Position ID
[12] MTS_CREATE int Millisecond timestamp of creation
[13] MTS_UPDATE int Millisecond timestamp of update
[ . . . ]
[15] TYPE int Identifies the type of position: 'null' = Margin position, 1 = Derivatives position
[ . . . ]
[17] COLLATERAL float Position collateral
[18] COLLATERAL_MIN float Min Collateral Required
[19] META JSON str Meta data about the position
`} **Ratelimit**: 90 req/min

get.description: Returns a list of VASP names along with their respective ID
This section contains the public endpoints related to Bitfinex Peer-to-Peer (P2P) Trading
Returns the public anonymous information about any valid user profile registered to the P2P service

parameters.name: profile_id
parameters.description: The P2P profile ID of the user you want to review

post.description: Send Multiple order-related operations. Please note the sent object has only one property with a value of an array of arrays detailing each order operation. (Max 75 operations per request)

type.description: Order Type: LIMIT, EXCHANGE LIMIT, MARKET, EXCHANGE MARKET, STOP, EXCHANGE STOP, STOP LIMIT, EXCHANGE STOP LIMIT, TRAILING STOP, EXCHANGE TRAILING STOP, FOK, EXCHANGE FOK, IOC, EXCHANGE IOC.

amount.description: Amount of order (positive for buy, negative for sell)

lev.description: Set the leverage for a derivative order, supported by derivative symbol orders only. The value should be between 1 and 100 inclusive. The field is optional, if omitted the default leverage value of 10 will be used.

price_trailing.description: The trailing price for a trailing stop order

tif.description: Time-In-Force: datetime for automatic order cancellation (e.g. 2020-01-15 10:45:23).

id.description: Order ID (Can be retrieved by calling the [Retrieve Orders](https://docs.bitfinex.com/reference#rest-auth-orders) endpoint)

all.description: Cancel all open orders if value is set to: 1

meta.description: Object to pass order meta data. Options: 'aff_code' (to pass affiliate codes), 'make_visible' (to toggle visible on hit for hidden orders), 'protect_selfmatch' (to cancel submitted order if it would match with one of your own orders). Example: meta: {aff_code: "AFF_CODE_HERE", make_visible: 1}

post.description:
View your past ledger entries. Most recent entries are returned by default, but a timestamp can be used to retrieve time-specific data.

The endpoint returns data up to 6 years old.

parameters.name: Currency
parameters.description: Currency (BTC, ...) For an up-to-date listing of supported currencies see: https://api.bitfinex.com/v2/conf/pub:map:currency:label (Can be omitted to retrieve Ledgers for all currencies)

category.description: Allows you to filter the ledger response using an int value. For a list of possible values, see the table below.

post.description: The claim feature allows the use of funds you have in your Margin Wallet to settle a leveraged position as an exchange buy or sale. Claiming some or all of a position requires that you have enough partially realized P/L (you've reduced the position at a profit) and/or funds (BTC or USD) in your Margin Wallet (net of any outstanding financing charges) to satisfy some or all of the outstanding financing associated with your position.

amount.description: Optional amount, used to perform a partial claim.

post.description:
Essentially a reverse of the [Claim Position](https://docs.bitfinex.com/reference#rest-auth-position-claim) feature, the Increase Position feature allows you to create a new position using the funds in your margin wallet. For more information about this feature, please look to the [Increase Position article](https://support.bitfinex.com/hc/en-us/articles/900004477903-Increase-Position) on our knowledge base.

The Increase Position feature requires a verified or paper trading account. Full verification is required to use the increase position feature to open a long position on pairs with a fiat quote currency.

symbol.description: Trading pair on which you wish to open a position

amount.description: Amount of the position. (positive for long, negative for short)

bp.description: bfx pay read/write permission, 0 - read, 1 - write

h.description: account history read/write permission, 0 - read, 1 - write

s.description: account settings read/write permission, 0 - read, 1 - write

currency.description: Select the currency that you would like to transfer (USD, UST, BTC, ....)

email_dst.description: Allows transfer of funds to a sub- or master-account identified by the associated email address.

user_id_dst.description: Allows transfer of funds to a sub- or master-account identified by the associated user id.

tfaToken.description: Required only when email_dst or user_id_dst is present and auth token is used instead of api credentials

method.description: 2FA method used, could be one of otp or u2f

response.description: Webauthn assertation challenge response, use when method is u2f

post.description: Submit an invoice for payment

amount.description: Invoice amount in currency (From 0.1 USD to 1000 USD)

currency.description: Invoice currency, currently supported: USD, EUR, GBP, CHF

payCurrencies.description: Currencies in which invoice accepts the payments, supported values are: BTC, ETH, UST-ETH, UST-TRX, LNX, LBT, UST-LBT, LTC, DOGE, MATIC, MATICM, AVAX, EUT-ETH

duration.description: Optional, invoice expire time in seconds, minimal duration is 5 mins (300) and maximal duration is 3 days (259200). Default value is 15 minutes

orderId.description: Reference order identifier in merchant's platform

webhook.description: Optional, the endpoint that will be called once the payment is completed/expired

redirectUrl.description: Optional, merchant redirect URL, this one is used in UI to redirect customer to merchant's site once the payment is completed/expired

customerInfo.description: Information related to customer against who the invoice is issued

nationality.description: Customer's nationality, alpha2 code or full country name (alpha2 preffered)

residCountry.description: Customer's residential country, alpha2 code or full country name (alpha2 preffered)

taxId.description: Optional tax id, required for type BUSINESS

env.description: Optional, merchant environment, allowed values: production, test, staging, development

tags.description: Optional, invoice tags, max number of tags is 5 and max length of tag is 5 characters

post.description: This section contains authenticated endpoints related to Bitfinex Peer-to-Peer (P2P) Trading
Returns the full information about the profile of the owner of the authentication token
Our P2P service includes a UI feature which informs other users if you are "online" at any given moment. This action pings our server to keep that status as "Online".
Returns the full information about one of your p2p listings

parameters.name: listing_id
parameters.description: ID of the listing you want to review

orderList.description: Returns a list of the order IDs associated to this listing (by default only the LIVE orders)

pastOrders.description: Returns all closed orders associated to this listing as well.Only valid if orderList is True.

fullOrderData.description: Returns the full order details instead of just the order ID. Only valid if orderList is True.

post.description: Returns a list of your P2P listings

listingType.description: Filters the results by one of the possible listing types  - "buy" or "sell"

status.description: Filters the results by one or more of the available listing statuses -  "live", "hidden", "blocked", "deleted"

baseCurrency.description: Filters the results by one of the supported digital assets to use as BASE_CUR

quoteCurrency.description: Filters the results by one of the supported fiat currencies or digital assets to be used as QUOTE_CUR

amount.description: Filters for listings in between MIN_ORDER_SIZE and MAX_ORDER_SIZE

minUsdVolume.description: Filters out ads with traded volume inferior to this value

listingLocation.description: Filters by one or more of the supported countries in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format

paymentMethods.description: Filters by one or more of the payment method model strings (as defined in /list/available-payment-methods)

minAvailability.description: Filters out listings with AVAILABILITY inferior to this value

page.description: Page of results to retrieve. Must be inferior or equal to the total number of pages of results.

sortField.description: Field by which to sort the date - one of "price", "createdAt", "baseCurrency", "quoteCurrency", "successRate", "volume"

sortOrder.description: Order by which to sort based on sortField - one of "asc", "desc"

limit.description: Number of results per page, used to define the total number of pages

### Response Fields | Index | Field | Type | Description | | :---- | :-------------- | :--------------------------------- | :-------------------------------------------------------- | | \[0] | POSITION\_ARRAY | [Position Array](#positions-array) | Each index contains one of the n current user's positions | #### Positions Array {`
Index Field Type Description
[0] SYMBOL string Pair (tBTCUSD ...)
[1] STATUS string Position status (ACTIVE)
[2] AMOUNT float Position value. Positive for long and negative for short positions
[3] BASE_PRICE float Base price of the position (average traded price of all previous orders related to the position).
[4] FUNDING float Amount of funding associated with the position
[5] FUNDING_TYPE int 0 for daily, 1 for term
[6] PL float Profit & Loss (includes 0.2% fee to close position)
[7] PL_PERC float Profit & loss percentage
[8] PRICE_LIQ float Liquidation price
[9] LEVERAGE float Leverage used for the position
[ . . . ]
[11] POSITION_ID int Position ID
[12] MTS_CREATE int Millisecond timestamp of creation
[13] MTS_UPDATE int Millisecond timestamp of update
[ . . . ]
[15] TYPE int Identifies the type of position: 'null' = Margin position, 1 = Derivatives position
[ . . . ]
[17] COLLATERAL float Position collateral
[18] COLLATERAL_MIN float Min Collateral Required
[19] META JSON str Meta data about the position
`} **Ratelimit**: 90 req/min

promos.title: Introduction
promos.text:
The Bitfinex APIs are designed to allow access to all of the features of the Bitfinex platform. The end goal is to allow people to potentially recreate the entire platform on their own.

If you would like to suggest changes to the documentation, please see the github at https://github.com/bitfinexcom/api_docs

# Open Source Libraries
The following open source projects are works in progress. We will be continually improving them, but we want to release them early so that the community can take a look, make use of them, and offer pull requests. Nothing in the Bitcoin world exists in isolation.
